title: Quentin Letts for the Daily Mail
text: Jeremy Corbyn, serial incompetent, tried to salute the House’s retiring Clerk but managed to get his name wrong. Mr Corbyn called him ‘Sir David Napley’. He is Sir David Natzler. David Napley was a notorious fixer and solicitor in the 1970s. One of his clients was Jeremy Thorpe. Natzler wrinkled his nose at Corbyn’s howler. Mr Corbyn tried to bag brownie points by mentioning Gordon Banks’s death. Mrs May, not to be outdone, started going on about Banks’s ‘astonishing Pele save in 1970’. She spoke these words in the same tone of voice she had used for an earlier answer on female genital mutilation. If put on stage, she’d empty Drury Lane’s Theatre Royal in minutes, this one. The late Stephen Hawking’s computerised larynx had more human gravy to it. ...read
description: Quentin Letts for the Daily Mail Columnist Archive for MailOnline
